column4: just out of curisouty and my stupidity, is ther ANY way to recover fiesl deleted with the rm command
i accidently deleted all the user dirs from /home
Are you using the partition where those dirs were deleted?
If any of that got overwritten, then probably not. But you can try PhotoRec (spelled right?) to search for deleted but still remaining data.
In the interest of hindsight, always do backups. :P
Tip: Get off that partition, and mount it read only.
Honestly, you've probably got your work cut out for you. PhotoRec is the only such tool I'm aware of, and it doesn't restore filenames, only looks for stuff on disk that it thinks looks like data.
But you don't want to be using that partition in the meantime.
Shut it down, burn a cd/memory stick with PartedMagic or similar.
The more you use the machine, the more data you lose. :P
I shudder to think of the logs of your IRC app overwriting valuable data.. :/
i was remotey connected to the server
Well, any data written to disk (like Firefox profiles and whatnot) can potentially take the place of a formerly referenced file's location on the disk.
Good luck, I might be having to use PhotoRec or something similar today too. :C
From a quick google search http://extundelete.sourceforge.net/
